method: Chicken Parmesan is a classic Italian-American dish that combines tender chicken cutlets with a rich tomato sauce and melted cheese. It's a mouthwatering combination of flavors and textures that will satisfy your cravings for a hearty and comforting meal.

To prepare Chicken Parmesan, start by pounding boneless, skinless chicken breasts until they are about 1/2 inch thick. This helps tenderize the meat and ensures even cooking. Then, season the chicken with salt, pepper, and your favorite herbs and spices.

Heat some olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook the chicken cutlets until they are golden brown on both sides and cooked through. This usually takes about 3-4 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the chicken breasts. Once cooked, transfer the chicken to a baking dish.
